name: Worldwide Soccer Multiple Choice Quiz | Soccer | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many different countries (Germany and West Germany count as 1)have won the world cup since its inception in 1930 throught to 1998?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Brazil (4), Italy and Germany (3 each), Uruguay and Argentina (2 each), plus England and France have won the World Cup.  Holland is next.

questions.text: What was the only team to defeat Argentina during the 1978 World Cup?
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	Italy beat Argentina 1-0 in the first round.

questions.text: Which club has won the second most number of European Cups (now European Champions League) behind Real Madrid?
questions.explanation:
AC Milan.

	From it sinception in 1956 to 2000 Real Madrid gave won this cup 8 times. AC Milan are second with 5 wins.

questions.text: How many different countries (Germany and West Germany count as one) have reached the final of the World Cup from 1930 through to the 16th World Cup in 1998?
questions.explanation:
11.

	Brazil (4), Italy and Germany (3 each), Uruguay and Argentina (2 each), plus England and France have won the World Cup. Czechoslovakia, Hungary and Holland (twice each), and Sweden have reached the final and lost.

questions.text: Which player had scored the most goals in the World Cup competition?
questions.explanation:
Gerd Muller.

	Gerd Muller scored 14 goals in '70 and '74 combined.

questions.text: Which national team was replaced by Denmark in the 1992 European Nation's Cup competition due to politics?
What country has produced the most players who have won European Player of the year at least 3 times?
questions.explanation:
Holland.

	Holland is the only country with more than one 3-time winner ... Johan Cruyff and Marco Van Basten

questions.text: Which team went the longest between World Cup trophies?
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	West Germany won the trophy in 1954, but had to wait until 1974 to win it again.  Italy's spell was longer.  They won it in 1938, then had to wait until 1982 before winning another one.
